subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: The United States will play its World Cup qualifier against Trinidad and Tobago in Nashville on April 1. The Americans, trying to qualify for their sixth straight World Cup, open the final round of the North and Central American and Caribbean region on Feb. 11 against Mexico in Columbus, Ohio. They play at El Salvador on March 28. Sites have not been picked for games against Honduras (June 6), El Salvador (Sept. 5) and Costa Rica (Oct. 14).
